result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius L. Levy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius L. Levy appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Demetrius L. Levy.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests an adjournment of the jury trial date due to the defendant's new case.  Court vacated jury trial date set for 10-26-2022.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
For reasons set forth in the record, Court waives defendant's appearance for today's status conference.
Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Attorney Toran lost Zoom connection. 
Case recalled at 2:09 p.m. and defendant appears by video means with attorney. State placed offer on the record.
Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense counsel recently retained. Defense requests time to review case with client.
Case adjourned.
  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer by Attorney Toran

Adjustment Number: 22A 066644,
Payable Number: 1020059,
Receipt Number: 22RP028697,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant states that he has retained Attorney Chernin but counsel coud not appear with him today and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. Defendant declined to be interviewed. 
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@01:30pm
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
